title: Traveling in Deep Snow Without Snowshoes
brief: How to manage travel when snow is 30+ centimeters deep and snowshoes aren't available.
steps: Step 1: Recognize that snow 30+ centimeters deep makes normal walking extremely difficult.
Step 2: If possible, make improvised snowshoes using willow branches, cloth strips, leather, or other materials.
Step 3: When traveling without snowshoes, follow existing trails or packed snow when available.
Step 4: Take frequent breaks as travel in deep snow is extremely energy-intensive.
Step 5: Be aware that foot travel leaves obvious tracks for pursuers to follow.
warnings: Travel in deep snow without snowshoes is nearly impossible and extremely exhausting.
Deep snow travel leaves clear trails that compromise stealth and evasion.
Avoid snow-covered streams as insulating snow may prevent ice formation over water.
